questions.question: What is the purpose of the `Event Loop` in JavaScript?
answers: Handles HTTP requests
Manages memory allocation
Handles asynchronous code execution
Executes synchronous code only

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a feature of ES6?
answers: Arrow functions
Prototype-based inheritance
Classes
Template literals

questions.question: What is the `Virtual DOM` in React?
answers: A lightweight copy of the real DOM that React uses for fast updates
A browser feature that helps with rendering speed
A technique for styling components
A custom component library in React

questions.question: What is the primary difference between `localStorage` and `sessionStorage`?
answers: `localStorage` is accessible across tabs, while `sessionStorage` is only available within the same session
`sessionStorage` persists across browser sessions, while `localStorage` is temporary
`sessionStorage` is only for cookies, while `localStorage` is for general storage
`localStorage` persists until cleared, while `sessionStorage` is cleared when the tab is closed

questions.question: What is the purpose of Webpack in a modern JavaScript project?
answers: Bundles JavaScript, CSS, and other assets to optimize loading time
Handles HTTP requests and APIs
Optimizes server-side rendering
Manages local storage for web applications

questions.question: What does the `this` keyword refer to in JavaScript?
answers: The function that was called
The object that owns the current function
The global window object
The object that invoked the current function

questions.question: What is CORS and why is it important in web development?
answers: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing, a security feature for sharing resources between different domains
Cross-Origin Resource Security, a feature for securing APIs
Cross-Origin Request Sharing, a security mechanism to prevent unauthorized cross-origin requests
Cross-Origin Retrieval Services, a service for fetching resources from external APIs

questions.question: Which CSS property can be used to create a flex container?
answers: display: flex
display: block
position: relative
float: left

questions.question: What is the role of `webpack.config.js` in a Webpack setup?
answers: Defines the webpack version to use in the project
Contains configuration for how Webpack should bundle files
Contains the list of files to be bundled
Defines the file extensions to support

questions.question: What is the purpose of server-side rendering (SSR) in React?
answers: To generate the initial HTML on the server for faster page loads
To allow React to execute JavaScript code on the server
To render the entire app in the browser before sending any HTML to the client
To fetch data from the server asynchronously before rendering

questions.question: What is a Progressive Web App (PWA)?
answers: A web app that can be installed as a native application
A web app that requires a JavaScript framework like Angular or React
A web app that works offline and provides a native-like experience
A web app that uses server-side rendering

questions.question: What is the purpose of `async/await` in JavaScript?
answers: To manage errors in asynchronous functions
To handle asynchronous operations in a more readable manner than `callbacks` or `promises`
To allow for synchronous code execution in asynchronous functions
To create parallel tasks in JavaScript

questions.question: What is the difference between `==` and `===` in JavaScript?
answers: `==` checks for equality with type conversion, while `===` checks for equality without type conversion
`==` checks for strict equality, while `===` checks for loose equality
`==` is faster than `===`
`===` only works for strings and numbers, while `==` works for all types

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a CSS preprocessor?
answers: SASS
React
Webpack
Node.js

questions.question: What is the role of the `Service Worker` in a Progressive Web App (PWA)?
answers: It acts as a proxy between the app and network, enabling offline functionality
It provides security by blocking malicious content
It manages user authentication
It handles requests to the server for fetching data

questions.question: Which HTTP method is used to update a resource in a REST API?
answers: GET
POST
PUT
DELETE
